title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2528.4 - Penalty for failure to register
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2528.4 - Penalty for failure to register

State Regulations
(a) The failure to properly and timely comply with the rent registration
requirements of this Part shall, until such time as such registration is
completed, bar an owner from applying for or collecting any rent in excess of: the base date rent, plus any lawful adjustments allowable prior to the failure
to register. Such a bar includes but is not limited to rent adjustments
pursuant to section
2522.8
of this Title. The late
filing of a registration shall result in the elimination, prospectively, of
such penalty, and for proceedings commenced on or after July 1, 1991, provided
that increases in the legal regulated rent were lawful except for the failure
to file a timely registration, an owner, upon the service and filing of a late
registration, shall not be found to have collected a rent in excess of the
legal regulated rent at any time prior to the filing of the late
registration. (b) The failure to
pay any administrative fees imposed by the RSL shall constitute a charge due
and owing the City of New York, and no penalty for such failure to pay shall be
imposed pursuant to this code. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
2528.4

Amended

New

York State Register November 8, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 45, eff. 11/8/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
